hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ismail ibn Umayya: The Prophet ﷺ passed by a grave and said: 'Do you know what this is?' They said: 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said: 'This is the grave of Abu Righal,' they said: 'And who is Abu Righal?' He said: 'A man who was from Thamud, he was in the sanctuary of Allah, so the sanctuary of Allah prevented the punishment of Allah from reaching him. When he left (the sanctuary), he was afflicted with what befell his people. He was buried here, and with him was buried a branch of gold. The people rushed to it and dug for it until they extracted the branch.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Tawus, from his father: There was a man in times past who was intelligent and wise. When he grew old, he retired in his house. One day he said to his son: 'I am troubled, if only you would bring some men to talk to me.' So his son gathered a group of men and said: 'Enter and speak with him. If you hear something reprehensible from him, forgive him, for he is old. If you hear something good from him, accept it.' They entered and the first thing he said was: 'Is not the most clever of the clever the one who has piety? And verily the most foolish of the foolish is the one who commits immorality. When one of you marries, let him marry from a good family. And when you perceive from a man a vice, beware of it, for it has companions.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Zuhri, from Ibrahim ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf: A man from the people of Sham came to Madinah and met the companions of the Prophet ﷺ and greeted them. Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf was away working in his land at al-Jurf. The man went to him and found him with his cloak off, a hoe in his hand, directing water in his land. When Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf saw him, he removed the hoe from his hand and put on his cloak. The man said: 'I came for one reason but saw something more amazing than it. What is it that we are quick in jihad and you are slow in it? We abstain from the world while you desire it? Yet you are our predecessors and the companions of our Prophet!' Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf said: 'We do not know except what you know, nor has come to us except what came to you. But we were tested with hardship and we were patient, and we were tested with ease yet we were not patient.'

hadiths.english_translation: And the Prophet ﷺ said: 'Every matter with which the son of Adam amuses himself is vain except three things: his shooting, his horsemanship, and his strengthening of his family'
